channel.title: Green Ruby
channel.description: Green Ruby News is a feed of fresh links of the week about ruby, javascript, webdev, devops, collected by mose every sunday

item.title: Green Ruby News #096
item.description: Here is another week of links. Pay some attention to the rubyconf videos that were published this week. Hey thanks xenor and simon for your help in links gathering in the last few weeks. As I'm still in France and on the move, and my time is scarce. But I'll be back to Taiwan next week.
item.content:encoded:
#096 - dec 7th 2014

Edito

Here is another week of links. Pay some attention to the rubyconf videos that were published this week. Hey thanks xenor and simon for your help in links gathering in the last few weeks. As I'm still in France and on the move, and my time is scarce. But I'll be back to Taiwan next week.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor, simon - the informers
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Qards
Nice design.
The Numbers project
Playing with numbers.
The DNA project
Very advanced multimedia experiment.
Deviantart relooking
The new look of devinatart.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
SecCasts
Free screencasts about web security, especially rails app.
CSS Specificity Graph Generator
Stylesheet analysis tool.
Learn Ruby on Rails
(book) a solid start on Ruby on Rails web development by Daniel Kehoe.
Forward
v2 of this forwarder service, shareable URL for your local dev site.
Nibbler
Website analyzer and report generator.
Devops Bookmarks
Discover tools and frameworks in the DevOps landscape.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rails 4.2.0.rc2
Rails 4.2 is almost there.
ruby-prof-flamegraph
Easily find bottlenecks in your Ruby code.
X Ray Machine
A logger/profiler that helps you to track heavy calls in rails apps.
Dashboards
Responsive dashboard templates for Bootstrap.
MozBrick
Collection of UI components designed for the easy and quick building of web application.
Rocket
App Container runtime, alternative to docker.
Golang Lib for DevOps
A nice collection of go libs for devops.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Better Globals With a Tiny ActiveSupport Module dec 1
Sometimes, a global in the right place can make your code a lot simpler.
Introduction to Service Worker dec 1
A service worker is a script that is run by your browser in the background, separate from a web page.
Automating CSS Regression Testing dec 1
Breaking CSS is easy, testing it is hard.
Clipping and Masking in CSS dec 2
Used to hide some parts of elements and show other parts.
A Point On MVC And Architecture dec 2
Does your project really need a MVC framework?
CoreOS Calls Docker 'Fundamentally Flawed' dec 2
CoreOS on Monday released a prototype alternative on GitHub called Rocket.
Top 15 JavaScript Libraries for December 2014 dec 3
Great selection of recent js libs.
A Guide to Caching Your Rails Application With Fastly dec 5
Fastly is a content delivery network (CDN).
RailsBricks: Start Faster with Rails dec 5
Gem that enables you to create Rails apps much faster by automating mundane setup tasks.
valid , valid? , valid! dec 5
Some interesting Ruby validation techniques.
Mootor, an HTML5 Framework for Mobile Development dec 5
HTML5 frameowrk for mobile development.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Sysadmincasts #41 (4m) dec 2
CLI Monday: apt-file and yum provides.
RubyConf 2014 (16 videos) dec 4
Videos of this year rubyconf from San Diego.
Keep ruby weird 2014 (8 videos) dec 5
Weirdness as a ruby conference topic.
Gorails 34 (10m) dec 5
Forms With Multiple Submit Buttons.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Web Platform Podcast 20 (1h10) nov 30
Mozilla Brick, ‘UIKit’ for The Web.
CodePen 28 (41m) dec 1
Users.
Ruby5 514 (8m) dec 2
Rails 4.2 RC1, Opal, Deployment, Interpol, Sportdb, Service Objects, Emails.
RubyRogues 184 (1h52) dec 3
What We Actually Know About Software Development and Why We Believe It's True with Greg Wilson and Andreas Stefik.
Cloudcast #172 (40m) dec 3
The State of Containers.
Puppet Podcast dec 2014 (34m) dec 3
Node Manager.
TheChangelog 133 (58m) dec 3
All Things Perl With Curtis 'Ovid' Poe.
Javascript Jabber 136 (47m) dec 3
TrackingJS with Eduardo Lundgren.
Adventure in angular #19 (44m) dec 4
Microsoft Tooling with Mads Kristensen.
Ruby on Rails podcast #178 (1h08) dec 4
Recruiting - Steve Robinson from rubynow.com.
Ruby5 515 (5m) dec 5
RubyConf 2014, Spyme, foreign keys, forwarding messages, free SecCasts.

item.title: Green Ruby News #095
item.description: This is a quick edition. Enjoy number 95 from Paris.
item.content:encoded:
#095 - nov 30th 2014

Edito

This is a quick edition. Enjoy number 95 from Paris.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor, simon - the informers
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
JS conf Argentina
Just a pretty good looking conf website.
Rolex Awards
Very nice scrolling overall.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Pixactly
Tests how well you know your pixels.
Exception Trap
Ruby on Rails and PHP Error Tracking and Exception Monitoring.
Snipt
The publishing platform for coders.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.2.0-preview2
Many new features and improvements.
Rails 4.2.0.rc1
Final 4.2 is almost ready.
Ronin
Ruby platform for vulnerability research and exploit development.
Refile
Ruby file uploads, take 3. By the original author of Carrierwave.
ScrollMagic
jQuery Plugin for magical scroll interactions.
Charted
A charting tool that produces automatic, shareable charts from any data file.
Ruxit
Automatic monitoring of Node.js applications.
Ok Go Web Template
A template for golang web applications inspired by Ruby on Rails.
Logspout
Log routing for Docker container logs.
LittleChef
Cook with Chef without a Chef Server.
Docker 1.3.2
Some security fixes.
CotEditor
Opensource Plain-Text Editor for OS X.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Challenges faced in a little larger Rails API project nov 23
Inside view on a rails API project.
Each... Or Else nov 24
Some thoughts about calling each on empty objects.
Unraveling String Key Performance in Ruby 2.2 nov 24
Optimizations added in Ruby 2.2.0 when working with a Hash and string keys.
CoffeeScript? TypeScript? How about JavaScript? nov 24
Do yourself a favor and master JavaScript first.
Fixing Fixtures nov 25
Long post about how to enjoy fixtures revival.
As programmers why we never finish our projects nov 25
Tips and tricks for getting projects done.
Dockerising a Rails App nov 26
Long post about how to enjoy fixtures revival.
Distributed Configuration, Dark Launching Using Consul nov 26
Hootsuite experience with implementing Consul to fit their need.
Let's Simplify Ruby nov 27
The flip flop operator wakes up old trends.
Async jobs between Go and Ruby nov 28
Go-Workers is a Sidekiq-compatible tool to handle jobs with Go, using almost the same DSL.
Elasticsearch Cluster Setup nov 29
Experience with setting up an ES cluster, explained.
Scaling Docker with Kubernetes nov 29
Diving into an example of usage of kubernetes for containers management.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Sysadmincasts #40 (11m) nov 27
Simple Project Planning for Sysadmins.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant Robots 124 (32m) nov 24
Maintaining Your Legacy (Scott Ford)
CodePen 27 (37m) nov 24
Scaling.
Ruby5 513 (6m) nov 25
Statically Typed Ruby, flip flop operator, Ferry, speeding up Capybara, Ruby meet up resources.
Web Platform Podcast 19 (47m) nov 25
Node.js Application Security.
RubyRogues 183 (1h01) nov 26
Consequences of Technology with Ben Hammersley.
Javascript Jabber 135 (54m) nov 26
Smallest Federated Wiki with Ward Cunningham.
Rails refactoring podcast #2 (34m) nov 27
The Rails Way, rails DNA, rails community history.
Adventure in angular #18 (35m) nov 27
Style Guides.
NodeUp #77 (1h23) nov 27
A testing show at campjs.
The bike shed #3 (25m) nov 28
Flipping the Script.
TheChangelog 132 (58m) nov 28
Buckets CMS on Node.js with Dave Kaneda.

item.title: Green Ruby News #094
item.description: I'm still on the move, this weekend at Rennes.
item.content:encoded:
#094 - nov 23th 2014

Edito

I'm still on the move, this weekend at Rennes.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor, tysliu - the informers
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Nothing but thieves
Simple but graphical band website.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Clean Ruby
(book) Write code that announces how it works with the techniques in this book
Stream
Build scalable newsfeeds & activity.
Komments
Simple comment embedding, an alternative to discuss ?
Crypton
So the server doesn't know the contents it's storing on behalf of users.
Ocean
Community of designers sharing feedback..

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rails 3.2.21, 4.0.12, and 4.1.8
Security fix version, note that 4.0.11.1 and 4.1.7.1 also are available for 'just the fix'.
Bh - Bootstrap Helpers
Include Bootstrap components in your Ruby apps with short, documented, tested helpers.
SimonSays
A simple, declarative, role-based access control system for Rails.
ApiView
Fast and small Object Serializer gem.
Hansi
Your Hipster ANSI color library.
ReadActivity
Supports read/unread status (including read_at), and more.
Stream Rails
Build activity feeds, newsfeeds and activity streams.
interact.js
JavaScript drag and drop, resizing and multi-touch gestures with inertia and snapping.
MetricsGraphics.js
Library built on top of D3 that is optimized for visualizing and laying out time-series data.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Difference Between various ways to launch irb nov 18
There are a lot of ways to launch a Ruby or Rails console.
Creating Rails Active Record Validation Contexts With Inheritance nov 18
Description of a technique for validations code organization.
Massive Garbage Collection Speedup in Ruby 2.2 nov 18
Some enhancements that are going to be in Ruby 2.2.
AWS Lambda Will Help Create a New Normal nov 18
Some enhancements that are going to be in Ruby 2.2.
Specifying Ruby on Rails Controllers with RSpec nov 19
Sharing about rspec in the form of a worked example.
Writing DSLs in Ruby without monkeypatching Object nov 19
write beautiful DSLs without polluting every Ruby object with your methods.
Are Your Cache-Control Directives Doing What They Are Supposed to Do? nov 19
Recap on various params impacting cache strategies in HTTP.
Mini-chat with Rails and Server-Sent Events nov 20
Example using Server Side EVents to replace websockets on a tutorial chat rails app.
Unicorn Unix Magic Tricks nov 20
Post based on the talk at the Arrrrcamp conf, best post about unicorn ever.
The Basics of Node.js Streams nov 20
Explore Streams in detail and understand how they can simplify I/O.
Sass Multiple Arguments, Lists or Arglist nov 20
Where to use list, where to use arglist, in functions and mixins arguments.
Raptor optimizations nov 21
How they made Raptor fast, the geeky details.
15 Best jQuery File Upload Plugins nov 22
Easily add file upload feature to web applications.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
ArrrrCamp 2014 Schedule (14 videos) nov 14
Videos from early october arrcamp.
Sysadmincasts #39 (11m) nov 17
CLI Monday: How to Keep Your SSH Sessions Alive.
CSS and the Critical Path (23m) nov 20
Patrick Hamann at CSSconf EU 2014.
Gorails 33 (24m) nov 21
Sign In With Twitter using Omniauth and the Twitter gem.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Web Platform Podcast 18 (50m) nov 17
ORTC & WebRTC Deep Dive with Tsahi Levent-Levi.
The bike shed #2 (35m) nov 17
Rails 4.2.
Food Fight Show 84 (59m) nov 17
Apache Kafka.
Giant Robots 123 (24m) nov 18
Don't Call It a Codecation (Chris Hunt)
Ruby5 511 (6m) nov 18
Ruby 2.1.5, Scribble, Curly, Rubysierung, Minitest-Reporters.
TheChangelog 131 (1h08) nov 18
The Road to Ember 2.0 with Tom Dale and Yehuda Katz.
RubyRogues 182 (1h05) nov 19
Keeping Libraries and Utilities Small and Simple with Michel Martens.
Javascript Jabber 134 (39m) nov 19
Quilljs with Jason Chen.
Adventure in angular #17 (31m) nov 20
AtScript with Miško Hevery.
Ruby5 512 (5m) nov 21
RubyConf 2014, accelerating Rails, RubyGems.org gets redesigned, Heroku HTTP Git, Rails released.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 177 (47m) nov 21
RefactorCop - Winner of the 2014 Rails Rumble.

item.title: Green Ruby News #093
item.description: This newsletter is sent from Marseille, gonna catch a train back to Paris now.
item.content:encoded:
#093 - nov 16th 2014

Edito

This newsletter is sent from Marseille, gonna catch a train back to Paris now.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Teye
Graphical presentation of a communication device.
Nerisson
Very graphical freelance website.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby on Rails ActiveRecord Model Visualizer
Draws an image with relationships between rails models.
Crypton
So the server doesn't know the contents it's storing on behalf of users.
Ocean
Community of designers sharing feedback..

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.1.5
This is a security release (CVE-2014-8090). Upgrades are also available on 1.9.3 and 2.0.0 branches.
Pakyow
Open-source platform for the modern web, like an alternative to rails.
Ru
Brings Ruby's expressiveness, cleanliness, and readability to the command line.
Scribble
Client facing template language similar to Liquid build in Ruby.
Maxitest
Minitest + all the features you always wanted.
ThemesOnRails
Adds multi themes support to your Rails 3/4 application.
SlimerJS
Interact with a web page through an external JS script (for testing, too).
Material ui
CSS Framework and a Set of React Components that Implement Google's Material Design.
Rancher
Portable AWS-style infrastructure service for Docker.
Bosun
An advanced, open-source monitoring and alerting system by Stack Exchange.
Dockership
Tool for easily deploying Docker containers to one or multiple Docker servers.
Raigad
Process/tool that runs alongside Elasticsearch to automate various things.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Rubinius 3.0 - Part 1: The Rubinius Team nov 10
First article in a serie of 5, published this week, all about rubinius 3.
Fun With the 'method' Method nov 10
Methods as easy as lambdas.
Natural Language Parsing with Ruby nov 11
Using treetop gem.
Making Ruby Faster nov 12
Some of the optimizations going on deep inside the guts of Ruby interpreter.
Prevent MySQL deadlocks in your Rails application nov 13
Some good advices and explanations about deadlocks and how to avoid them.
Clojure Loops in Ruby nov 13
Someone decided to port this new Clojure loop into Ruby, and explains how.
20 Free Data Visualization Tools nov 13
Quite a good list.
AWS EC2 Container Service nov 13
A lot of new things this week at AWS, this is only one of them.
Speed Up JavaScript Capybara Specs nov 14
... by Blacklisting URLs.
7 Unique Ways To Practice Your Coding Skills nov 14
Some innovative websites you may already know, or not.
Shorter, simpler code with Forwardable nov 15
And use of the delegate method.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Web Components - Custom Elements (8m) nov 11
How to work with Custom Elements.
Gorails 32 (17m) nov 14
Markdown and Emoji with the html-pipeline gem.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant Robots 122 (50m) nov 10
Ruby, the Weird Way (Britt Ballard, Caleb Thompson, Richard Schneeman, Terence Lee)
Ruby5 509 (5m) nov 11
CLI gems, autoload paths, Ruby and Rails releases, static analysis.
TheChangelog 130 (1h05) nov 11
Sidekiq, Inspeqtor and OSS Products With Mike Perham.
RubyRogues 180 (1h15) nov 12
RubyInstaller with Luis Lavena.
Javascript Jabber 133 (53m) nov 12
Remote Work with Mike Hostetler.
Arrested Devops 24 (1h06) nov 12
Git 101.
Adventure in angular #16 (54m) nov 13
NG 1.3 and 2.0 with Brad Green, Igor Minar, and Miško Hevery.
The Cloudcast #171 (22m) nov 13
Evolving API Economy & Hackathons .
Ruby5 510 (5m) nov 14
Tail call optimizations, keeping migrations healthy, how raptor is faster, psychology of SAAS products,Ru.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 176 (58m) nov 14
Rails Rumble 2014 Solo Winner - Flora Saramago .
NodeUp 76 (1h18) nov 14
A structuring applications show.

item.title: Green Ruby News #092
item.description: My new job is much deeper in devops than before. Gandi really is a great environment for real geeks. Rails and ruby still remains dear to my heart, but now this becomes a side interest for me. I hope I still can keep up with this weekly gathering of links. Some focus may change though. I'm switching now from chef to puppet, and I may have even more interest on devops links. But I will try to keep it balanced. Maybe organize the links gathering a little more collaboratively?
item.content:encoded:
#092 - nov 9th 2014

Edito

My new job is much deeper in devops than before. Gandi really is a great environment for real geeks. Rails and ruby still remains dear to my heart, but now this becomes a side interest for me. I hope I still can keep up with this weekly gathering of links. Some focus may change though. I'm switching now from chef to puppet, and I may have even more interest on devops links. But I will try to keep it balanced. Maybe organize the links gathering a little more collaboratively?

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
TwoFold
Website of a design agency, pretty beautiful.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Bada55
BADA55.io is about finding the most badass leet words for your CSS hex colors.
Useful Chrome Extensions for Designers & Developers
20 chrome extensions you may need.
Do
Helps people run productive meetings.
Stackshare
Discover what top companies are using.
Cheatography
Cheat sheet generator and repository where you can build and share cheat sheets.
Pixelapse
Visual version control and collaboration workflow for open source and private design projects.
Google Container Engine
Run Docker containers on Google Cloud Platform, powered by Kubernetes.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.2 packages for Ubuntu
Brightbox packaged ruby 2.2.0 preview 1.
Shoryuken
AWS SQS thread based message processor for Ruby.
Pronto
Quick automated code review of your changes.
RailsStats
See stuff about a Rails app.
Close Enough
For dyslexic coders. Yes, it's a joke.
Twemoji
Open sourcing Twitter emoji for everyone.
Stager
Automatically build staging environments from GitHub pull requests.
Materialize
A modern responsive front-end framework based on Material Design.
ShadowCrypt
Encrypt your social communications.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Getting Started with Hadoop nov 3
Basics of what Hadoop is, what options are out there, setting up a basic cluster.
Why your code is so hard to understand nov 3
Why my code makes perfect sense while I am writing it but looks like gibberish when I go back to it later.
Benchmarking Rack Middleware nov 3
If we can't measure something, we can't make it fast.
'respond_to' Without All the Pain nov 3
If you want to return different information for different formats, you have a few options.
Rails Rumble Gem Teardown nov 4
166 Gemfiles analyzed to see what tools rails rumblers have used.
Fluentd Goes Gopher nov 4
Fluentd forwarder now will be written in go (like logstash forwarder, interestingly).
AngularJS: The Bad Parts nov 5
Opinion: Whatever the reason is for Angulars popularity, it isn’t that it’s a great framework.
The Ruby Ecosystem for New Rubyists nov 6
Review of various initial ruby tools that newcomers to ruby should be aware about.
Rust and Go nov 7
Brief comparison between Rust and Go, picking up on some of the nice features in both.
Lazy Refactoring nov 7
Example of step by step refactoring using lazy enumerators.
State Machines in Ruby nov 7
Example of step by step refactoring using lazy enumerators.
Layout Math with CSS: Understanding calc nov 8
A couple of examples of usage of calc() in css.
PID tracking in modern init systems nov 9
Two ways of enabling daemons to coexist with upstart and systemd.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Time Zones using the local_time Gem (12m) nov 6
A look into times, timezones, and how to handle it better with javascript.
DevOps Enterprise Summit 2014 (27 videos) nov 6
Recordings of talks from the DevOps Enterprise Summit, held October 21 - 23, 2014.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant Robots 121 (32m) nov 3
Prolificness (Allison House)
Ruby5 507 (7m) nov 4
Rubinius 2.3.0, Zopfli-ffi, Benchmarking Rack, Enums and Queries, Ruby Garbage Collector, Hunting for Leaks in Ruby.
CenturyLink Labs #20 (35m) nov 4
Geeking Out On APIs With Wynn Netherland from GitHub.
NodeUp 75 (52m) nov 4
A nodeforward show.
Food Fight Show 83 (52m) nov 4
DevOpsDays Belgium 2014.
The ShipShow 51 (1h) nov 4
Five Years of DevOps (and Its Days).
RubyRogues 180 (59m) nov 5
Barriers to New Developers with Kinsey Ann Durham.
Javascript Jabber 132 (58m) nov 5
MV Frameworks with Craig McKeachie.
Adventure in angular #15 (34m) nov 6
Angular and Kendo UI with Jesse Liberty.
Web Platform #17 (1h06) nov 6
The Famo.us vision of 'Mobile First'.
Ruby5 508 (6m) nov 7
Rails Rumble Gem, Shopify admin, 4 ways to setup minitest, Rails with Ember.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 175 (1h06) nov 7
Carlos Souza from Code School.
The Cloudcast #170 (35m) nov 8
Reigniting of the Cloud Wars.

item.title: Green Ruby News #091
item.description: This week I left my job at Faria and I joined Gandi Asia, as a devops again. The consequence is that I'm flying to Paris next week for one month. I wonder if I will be able to feed up Greenruby links curation as regularly as usual. That may be challenging. In the while, check out the Rails Rumble Winners for this year, there is some cool things.
item.content:encoded:
#091 - nov 2nd 2014

Edito

This week I left my job at Faria and I joined Gandi Asia, as a devops again. The consequence is that I'm flying to Paris next week for one month. I wonder if I will be able to feed up Greenruby links curation as regularly as usual. That may be challenging. In the while, check out the Rails Rumble Winners for this year, there is some cool things.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Benoît Boucart
Benoît Boucart, a web designer, made a nice looking timeline.
Emoji Tracker
Realtime emoji use on twitter.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Trailblazer book
(Book) A New Architecture For Rails (writing still in progress).
Polarr
A WebGL photo editor faster than Adobe Lightroom.
Gitgo
Free private version control hosting, charging per volume above 200M, not per accounts or repos.
Orion
Open Source Platform For Cloud Based Development, online IDE from eclipse.
Whiteout
Email encryption for the rest of us.
Packager
Distributing and installing modern web applications, automatically packaged.
Magic Import
The fastest way to turn a webpage into a table of data.
ZenHub
Turns GitHub Issues into real time draggable cards on shared Boards.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.1.4
Mostly a security release, with also some bugfixes.
Rails 3.2.20, 4.0.11, 4.1.7, and 4.2.0.beta3
A security upgrade related to CVE-2014-7818.
Rails 4.2.0.beta4
The beta3 was just a security upgrade, this beta4 contains the real changes towards RC.
Rubinius 2.3.0
A big changelog for this new version of rbx.
TTY::ProgressBar
A flexible progress bars drawing in terminal emulators.
rdoc-generator-mdoc
This generator outputs gem documentation in man format.
RailsScript
Rails-centric, object oriented, featherweight framework for writing CoffeeScript.
Dashboards
Responsive Dashboard Templates for Bootstrap.
linux_provision
Library for provisioning initial setup of Linux computer for Ruby/Rails development.
OSquery
Use SQL to query low-level operating system information.
pgweb
Web-based PostgreSQL database browser written in Go.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Adding reentrancy fallback for your Sidekiq workers oct 27
A nice way to implement reentrancy.
I Went to Haskell and All I Got Was a Pattern Matcher for Ruby oct 27
Defp is a pattern matcher implementation written for and in ruby.
Containerization, Security and Trust Models oct 27
New signed builds in docker 1.3 brings the topic of trust and key management.
Let’s Get Serious About Readability oct 28
What makes code readable.
In search of the perfect JavaScript framework oct 28
Review of the criteria to take in account when making a choice of js framework.
jQuery 3.0: The Next Generations oct 29
How compat will be handled in the next verion os jquery.
Memoization in Ruby Using Metaprogramming oct 29
Example of memoization with a function that calculates factorial recursively.
Real World Examples of Rails Engines in Action oct 29
4 rails engine examined (forem, devise, spree, refinery).
4 Fantastic Ways to Set Up State in Minitest oct 29
How to add the missing parts for minitest to compete with Rspec.
What I Learned About Hunting Memory Leaks in Ruby 2.1 oct 30
Example and resources to optimize ruby programs, checking rbtrace dumps.
Ruby is about to get red hot. Again. oct 30
Various ruby-based solutions to bring ruby everywhere (especially volt and rubyfire seem cool, for web apps).
How to write code that speaks for itself oct 30
Self documenting code is code that speaks for itself.
Feature Flags on Rails oct 30
Use the Rollout gem as a way of implementing Feature flags.
The Best Plugins for Sublime Text oct 30
Subjective but extensive list of ST3 plugins.
PGP and You oct 31
Great primer that enables encrypted communication between individuals (more and more a required concern).

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
AtoZ CSS: z-index (8m) oct 30
Stacking order for DOM elements.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Product Hunt Radio 27 (43m) oct 28
Talking about Hackathons.
CodePen 025 (36m) oct 28
Payments, Stripe, IPN.
Giant Robots 120 (54m) oct 28
Open Your World For Commentary (Tom Lehman)
Ruby5 506 (6m) oct 28
Pocketsphinx-ruby, Lita, ognivo, Neo4j in rails, rails rumble winners.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 174 (1h11) oct 29
Introduction to Ninefold for Rails Hosting.
RubyRogues 179 (1h32) oct 29
Accountability and Diversity with Meagan Waller.
Javascript Jabber 131 (49m) oct 29
Conferences & Meetups with Dave Nugent.
The Cloudcast #168 (22m) oct 29
Containerized Continuous Delivery.
The Cloudcast #169 (26m) oct 29
DevOps Incident Management with BigPanda.
CenturyLink Labs #19 (37m) oct 29
Making Clustered Infra Look Like One Big Server with Mesosphere and Florian Leibert.
Adventure in angular #14 (38m) oct 30
Using ES6 with Angular with Scott Allen.
Web Platform #16 (1h09) nov 1
Measures of Success in Pair Programming.

item.title: Green Ruby News #090
item.description: Rails Rumble 2014 winners will be announced in a few hours, you can check the list of submissions. There is a lot of creative ideas over there.
item.content:encoded:
#090 - oct 26th 2014

Edito

Rails Rumble 2014 winners will be announced in a few hours, you can check the list of submissions. There is a lot of creative ideas over there.

item.title: Green Ruby News #089
item.description: This weekend Rails Rumble is ending up right now. Results will have to wait one week but I bet there will be interesting projects to check out.
item.content:encoded:
#089 - oct 19th 2014

Edito

This weekend Rails Rumble is ending up right now. Results will have to wait one week but I bet there will be interesting projects to check out.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Fluky
Make you own wheel of fortune and roll it.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.

This is not a new site, but it can help onboard new rubyists.
Fast ruby
List of benchmarking examples of ruby code, comparing alternatives.
Mastering Modern Payments
(Book) Complete guide to getting paid with Stripe and Rails.

Form endpoints for designers and developers.
GildeRoom
Hangouts without the hangups (webrtc based).

(Book) Get intimate with Sublime Text.

Online mail composer for campaigns, by Mailup.

A color display the size of your thumb.
React Fundamentals
Basic fundamentals of React to get you started.
Learn all the nodes
Screencasts about node.js.
Intro to D3.js
This tutorial provides a quick intro to D3.js (not a deep dive).
Building Web Apps with Go
(Book) Learn how to build and deploy web applications with Go..

Install

A radically new Ruby web server (to be released next month).

JRuby on Android, new version.

A high level wrapper for Phantomjs.

Open software ecosystem for WebGL, built on top of browserify and npm.

Responsive website screenshots from the commandline.
EditorConfig
Helps developers maintain consistent coding styles between different editors.
Fig 1.0
A ton of improvements in this release, including compatibility with boot2docker on OS X.
Dockerize
Utility to simplify running applications in docker containers.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...

Full tutorial based on the RaspberryPi-Tv project.
How Does Rails Handle Gems? oct 13
How do Bundler, Rails, and RubyGems work together to make handling dependencies easy.
Leverage Bundler to Get Private Git Repos on Docker Images oct 14

Polymorphic relations with pg_morph oct 14
Simplify your life with pg_morph.
How Poodle Happened oct 14
Detailled history about this last SSL hole.
CSS-Only Solution For UI Tracking oct 16

How to Conduct A Content Audit oct 16
For any kind of redesign project you may need to perform a content audit.
8 steps to move Rails view to Marionette oct 16
Use Devise with AngularJS.
How to Set Up Authentication with AngularJS and Ruby on Rails oct 17
Howto with code for moving rails views to backbone and marionette.
Clean Up After Your Capybara oct 17
Avoid the tangled web of test code and markup.
Build a Custom API to Connect WordPress With Ruby on Rails oct 19
The Grape gem for creating an API to expose a part of a Ruby on Rails based shopping cart to outside applications.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...

Create a Hello World application in rubymotion.
AtoZ CSS: TranslateX (5m) oct 16

Listen

Scare Yourself (Dan Martell).
Ruby5 502 (6m) oct 14
RailsRumble, Ruby Motion for Rails devs, Ruby Hashes, data migrations, clean routes, better logs.
NodeUp 74 (47m) oct 14
A future of npm show.

Managing Systems In The Cloud.
Ops All The Things 011 (50m) oct 14
All About Attitude.

DevOps Automation as a Service.

Unary Operators, Writing fast Ruby, each_with_object, ES6 Transpiler, HStore.

Directives.

heyswell.com and Rails Rumble countdown.

item.title: Green Ruby News #088

item.content:encoded:

item.title: Green Ruby News #087
item.description:
As there is a lot of new subscribers this week, let me remind you what this newsletter is.
I'm a french fullstack geek living in Taiwan, ruby lover, and currently in a devops phase. I don't have much time to surf around during the week as I have a fulltime job. So every Sunday I dedicate 4 to 6 hours to sort my inbox, check stuff, track what's new, so I can remain current.
And then as I'm doing it for myself, well, I structured it a bit and sent my review to some friends. Mailchimp offers a free tier, the review is done already, why not share it to a wider audience. Xenor sends me some links every week, as well as various other people now. Having more people reading it and appreciating this review helps me to stay motivated doing it every week. So, thanks for that.
item.content:encoded:
#087 - oct 5th 2014

Edito

As there is a lot of new subscribers this week, let me remind you what this newsletter is.
I'm a french fullstack geek living in Taiwan, ruby lover, and currently in a devops phase. I don't have much time to surf around during the week as I have a fulltime job. So every Sunday I dedicate 4 to 6 hours to sort my inbox, check stuff, track what's new, so I can remain current.
And then as I'm doing it for myself, well, I structured it a bit and sent my review to some friends. Mailchimp offers a free tier, the review is done already, why not share it to a wider audience. Xenor sends me some links every week, as well as various other people now. Having more people reading it and appreciating this review helps me to stay motivated doing it every week. So, thanks for that.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...

CDN acceptance testing oct 1

Getting Started With Active Job oct 1
With the release of Rails 4.2, Active Job abstracts background workers syntax.
Taste and The Zen of GitHub oct 2
What taste means in Github growth.
Code Reviews at Harvest oct 2
Some good ideas about how to do the code review.
What is kubernetes and how to use it oct 2
Solution to scale your web services both vertically and horizontally.
Rails with Webpack - Why and How oct 2
An alternative for bundling your assets for some projects.
Refactoring Ruby with Monads oct 3
How monads can help to make code simpler, clearer and more reusable.
Better Know Enumerable: Partition oct 3
Using the partition to split a collection into two complementary parts.
AngularJS Tutorial: A Comprehensive 10,000 Word Guide oct 3
An ultimate resource point to begin learning AngularJS.

Watch

The vertical-align property and how and when it works.
Gogaruco 2014 (13 videos) oct 3
Golden Gate Ruby Conference.

With Tom Limoncelli.
